intro: Tithymalus herniariifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The leaves are typically narrow and elongated, with a slightly hairy surface. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. It plays a role in supporting pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native environments.
